reg:regulation.reg:title:
Health Professions Designation and
Amalgamation Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Health Professions Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The designations of the following health professions are continued for the purposes of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: dental hygiene;
dental technology;
denturism;
dietetics;
massage therapy;
midwifery;
naturopathic medicine;
nursing;
occupational therapy;
opticianry;
physical therapy;
psychology;
psychiatric nursing;
traditional Chinese medicine and acupuncture.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The designation of licensed practical nursing is continued, for the purposes of the Act, as practical nursing.
The following professions are designated for the purposes of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: audiology, hearing instrument dispensing and speech-language pathology;
chiropractic;
optometry;
the practice of pharmacy;
dentistry;
medicine;
podiatric medicine;
clinical perfusion, respiratory therapy, radiation therapy and medical laboratory technology.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The application fee to be submitted with an application under section 7 (1) of the Act is $2 000.

The minister may not charge to a health profession association the first $7 500 of costs incurred by the minister in the conduct of the investigation of the health profession association's application under section 7 (1) of the Act.

If the minister conducts one investigation for the designation of a health profession in respect of more than one application under section 7 (1) of the Act, the fee payable under section 3 and the costs in excess of the amount under section 4 may be prorated by the minister between or among the health profession associations that have applied.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Criteria for designation of health professions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 10 (1) of the Act, the minister must consider the extent to which the practice of a health profession may involve a risk of physical, mental or emotional harm to the health, safety or well-being of the public, having regard to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the services performed by practitioners of the health profession;
the technology, including instruments and materials, used by practitioners of the health profession;
the invasiveness of the procedure or mode of treatment used by practitioners of the health profession;
the degree to which the health profession is practised

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under the supervision of another person who is qualified to practise as a member of a different health profession, or

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may also consider the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the extent to which the health profession has demonstrated that there is a public interest in ensuring the availability of regulated services provided by the health profession;
the extent to which the services of the health profession provide a recognized and demonstrated benefit to the health, safety or well-being of the public;
the extent to which there exists a body of knowledge that forms the basis of the standards of practice of the health profession;
whether practitioners of the health profession are awarded a certificate or degree from a recognized post-secondary educational institution;
whether it is important that continuing competence of a practitioner of the health profession be monitored;
the extent to which there exists within the health profession recognized leadership which has expressed a commitment to regulating the profession in the public interest;
the likelihood that a college established under the Act would be capable of carrying out the duties imposed by the Act, having regard to factors that may affect the viable operation of the college;
whether designation of the health profession is likely to limit availability of services contrary to the public interest.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following colleges are amalgamated into one college:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the College of Licensed Practical Nurses of British Columbia;
the College of Registered Nurses of British Columbia;
the College of Registered Psychiatric Nurses of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amalgamation date for the purpose of subsection (1) is September 4, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amalgamation of colleges of physicians and surgeons and podiatric surgeons

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following colleges are amalgamated into one college:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the College of Physicians and Surgeons of British Columbia;
the College of Podiatric Surgeons of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amalgamation date for the purpose of subsection (1) is August 31, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amalgamation of midwife and nursing colleges

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following colleges are amalgamated into one college:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the College of Midwives of British Columbia;
the British Columbia College of Nursing Professionals.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amalgamation date for the purpose of subsection (1) is September 1, 2020.
The following colleges are amalgamated into one college:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the College of Dental Hygienists of British Columbia;
the College of Dental Surgeons of British Columbia;
the College of Dental Technicians of British Columbia;
the College of Denturists of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amalgamation date for the purpose of subsection (1) is September 1, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amalgamation of colleges of health and care professionals

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following colleges are amalgamated into one college:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the College of Dietitians of British Columbia;
the College of Occupational Therapists of British Columbia;
the College of Opticians of British Columbia;
the College of Optometrists of British Columbia;
the College of Physical Therapists of British Columbia;
the College of Psychologists of British Columbia;
the College of Speech and Hearing Health Professionals of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amalgamation date for the purpose of subsection (1) is June 28, 2024.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amalgamation of colleges of complementary health professionals

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following colleges are amalgamated into one college:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the College of Chiropractors of British Columbia;
the College of Massage Therapists of British Columbia;
the College of Naturopathic Physicians of British Columbia;
the College of Traditional Chinese Medicine Practitioners and Acupuncturists of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amalgamation date for the purpose of subsection (1) is June 28, 2024.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Health Professions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 183, ss. 12 and 25.03.]
